Class Calculator

  • java.lang.Object
    • Calculator

  • public class Calculator
extends java.lang.Object
    Calculator is a simple java application which parses mathematical expressions and evaluates the result. Calculator can parse arithmetic operators as well as some functions, store variables, and carry out some pre-defined commands. A complete manual on how to use this application can be found in the README files, or by entering /help during runtime. A continuously updated version of this project can be found online at my Github repository.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0, 17/10/2016
    Author:
    Satvik Saha
    See Also:
    http://github.com/sahasatvik/Calculator, ExpressionParser

    • Field Detail

      • commandRegex

        public static java.lang.String commandRegex
        Regex which matches a command. This is simply a string of characters following a forward slash (/).

      • previousAns

        public static java.lang.String previousAns
        Stores the previously calculated answer. This can be retrieved during runtime as a variable.

      • expParser

        public static ExpressionParser expParser
        ExpressionParser object which contains methods for parsing arithmetic expressions.

      • evaluate

        public static java.lang.String evaluate(java.lang.String exp)
                                 throws ExpressionParserException
        Evaluate a mathematical expression and return the result.
        Parameters:
        exp - the expression to be parsed
        Returns:
        the evaluated result
        Throws:
        ExpressionParserException - thrown when an exception is encountered while parsing the expression
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        ExpressionParser.evaluate(String)

      • parseCommand

        public static void parseCommand(java.lang.String command)
                         throws CommandNotFoundException
        Parses a command intended for the Calculator shell.
        Parameters:
        command - the command to be parsed
        Throws:
        CommandNotFoundException - thrown when an unrecognized command is passed here
        Since:
